intro: Cyrtosia integra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Cyrtosia integra is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
